alert.note: Alert for Durham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 3:57PM EDT until May 06 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WAKE AND SOUTHEASTERN DURHAM COUNTIES... At 355 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near RDU International, or 8 miles north of Raleigh, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 346 PM, there were multiple reports of quarter sized hail in Morrisville. At 346 PM, a 63 mph wind gust was also measured at RDU Airport. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, RDU International, Morrisville, Falls Lake State Rec Area, Gorman, William B Umstead State Park, Research Triangle and Falls Lake. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
